references.paper_title: Persianllama: Towards building first persian large language model
references.reason: This paper is highly relevant as it addresses the cultural bias problem in LLMs by proposing a solution to improve the representation of Persian language and culture in large language models.

references.paper_title: Submodularity in machine learning and artificial intelligence
references.reason: This paper provides crucial theoretical background on submodularity, a key concept for evaluating dataset diversity and data augmentation which are major aspects of the CulturePark approach.

references.paper_title: Assessing cross-cultural alignment between chatgpt and human societies: An empirical study
references.reason: This paper is highly relevant because it directly addresses the issue of cultural bias in LLMs, specifically focusing on ChatGPT and conducting an empirical study to assess its cross-cultural alignment capabilities.

references.paper_title: Cognitive conflict and goal conflict effects on task performance
references.reason: This paper is foundational to the theoretical basis of CulturePark, which leverages cognitive conflict theory to generate high-quality cross-cultural dialogue data.
